title:
From curve shortening to flat link stability and Birkhoff sections of
  geodesic flows
authors: Marcelo R. R. Alves, Marco Mazzucchelli
abstract:
We employ the curve shortening flow to establish three new theorems on the
dynamics of geodesic flows of closed Riemannian surfaces. The first one is the
stability, under $C^0$-small perturbations of the Riemannian metric, of certain
flat links of closed geodesics. The second one is a forced existence theorem
for orientable closed Riemannian surfaces of positive genus, asserting that the
existence of a contractible simple closed geodesic $\gamma$ forces the
existence of infinitely many closed geodesics intersecting $\gamma$ in every
primitive free homotopy class of loops. The third theorem asserts the existence
of Birkhoff sections for the geodesic flow of any closed orientable Riemannian
surface of positive genus.
